list_definition.definition: to sell (goods) (usually in small quantities) to the person who is going to use them (rather than to someone who is going to sell them to someone else)
relating to the sale of goods in this way
the activity of selling goods to customers for their own use

list_ex_of_english: The orthokinetic chair retails in this country at about £400 depending on the accessories required.
There are many factories which supply shops in which goods are retailed.
I have asked how many licences have been withdrawn from licensed premises because they were retailing smuggled and bootlegged goods.
The only instance where it need not be graded is where a farmer sells direct to the shop from which it will then be retailed.
Who is it to be sold to and at what price is it to be retailed?
There may be a case for examining car pricing and the way in which cars are retailed in this country.
In the main, he simply retails programme services which are provided by others.
We also welcome the measures on wine, but the retails are a little less certain than they were.
